block.p: LEAD: A 16-year-old youth from the Bronx drowned in the Harlem River yesterday after he apparently struck a bridge pier while swimming with friends, the police said. The youth, Jose Angel Romero, of 2615 Third Avenue, near 141st Street, was swimming about 6 P.M. with four companions near the Madison Avenue Bridge when he struck the pier and disappeared, according to a police spokesman, Officer Peter O'Donnell.
